sen.j: 大炊御門 宗氏（おおいのみかど むねうじ、天授 (日本)元年・永和 (日本)元年（1375年） - 応永28年4月6日 (旧暦)（1421年5月7日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代の公卿。
sen.e: Muneuji OINOMIKADO (1375-May 7, 1421) was Kugyo (the top court official) who lived from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts to the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 後小松天皇（100代）・称光天皇（101代）の二朝にわたって仕え、官位は正二位内大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He served in two generations of the Emperor Gokomatsu (the hundredth) and the Emperor Shoko (the one hundred and first), and promoted up to Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Naidaijin (minister).
He served the two generations of Emperor Gokomatsu (the 100th) and Emperor Shoko (the 101st), and was promoted to Shonii (Senior 2nd Rank), Naidaijin (minister).

sen.j: 応永5年（1398年）に従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: He became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1398 and was raised to Kugyo.

sen.j: 備前権守、参議、中納言、権大納言などを歴任し、応永27年（1420年）に内大臣となるも翌年には死去した。
sen.e: Though he became Naidaijin in 1420 after experiencing Bizen gon no kami (provisional governor of Bizen Province), Sangi (councilor), Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), Gon Dainagon (provisional major councilor) and other positions, he died the next year.
